The only money that should be turned over to the County is insurance proceeds designated for debris removal, less any reimbursable expenses for additional debris removal or for repairs to property caused by the debris removal process. More information: http://www.sonomacoutyrecovers.org

Update for Fire Survivors: (1/2) Many fire survivors have received copies of invoices sent to their insurance company for the Government-Sponsored Debris Removal work by FEMA. PROPERTY OWNERS ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE INVOICE.pic.twitter.com/VXDVdqCXl1

The County of Sonoma has started collecting insurance funds for debris removal on behalf of FEMA & CalOES. Update / Actualización [9/25 - 4PM]: Power has been fully restored in Sonoma County. Restauraron la electricidad completamente en el Condado de Sonoma.pic.twitter.com/335twVUp9y

Actualización de PG&E: Las condiciones del clima han mejorado y cuadrillas están inspeccionando equipos para determinar que tan rápido se puede restaurar el servicio. Se espera restaurar el servicio completamente el 25 de sept., mientras no cambie el resultado de las inspecciones

@PGE4Me update: [9/25 - 2PM] Weather conditions have now improved and crews are inspecting equipment to determine how quickly we can safely restore service. Pending the result of our patrols, we expect service to be fully restored on September 25th.

(( 9/24 - 11pm)) PG&E will open a Community Resource Center at the Santa Rosa Veterans building (1351 Maple Ave) from 8 am to 6 pm tomorrow 9/25 ** PG&E abrirá Centro de Recursos Comunitario en el edifico de veteranos de Santa Rosa (1351 Maple Ave) de 8 am a 6 pm mañana 25 sept

Con el pronóstico de lluvia para este fin de semana, si está amontonando escombros de las inundaciones en su calle, asegúrese de cubrirlos con una lona para evitar que el viento se los lleve y los vertidos potencialmente dañinos que pueden ocurrir si se mojan.

Al limpiar, use protección para evitar la exposición al moho y la contaminación por inundación: ○Máscara N-95 ○Botas de goma ○Guantes de goma ○Lentes de protección ○Pantalones largos, camisa de manga larga y botas o zapatos de trabajo

Si va a sacar los escombros de las inundaciones a la calle e incluyen refrigeradores o congeladores, retire todas las puertas antes de sacarlos. Los niños y los animales pueden quedar atrapados al pasar por ahí o si juegan dentro de ellos.

Con el pronóstico de lluvia para el fin de semana, tenga en cuenta que puede haber avalanchas de barro. Consulte la página de información sobre preparación para avalanchas de barro aquí https://socoemergency.org/home/prepare/mudslides/ ….

Shelter information: Sebastopol Center for the Arts is closed. The Santa Rosa shelter has been moved from Grace Pavilion to Garrett Hall at the Sonoma County Fairgrounds.

Monetary donations cannot be accepted at this time. Three Goodwill locations in Santa Rosa, 651 Yolanda, 1300 4t St., and 3535 Industrial Drive Goodwill in Sebastopol, 6826 Sebastopol Ave. Goodwill in Windsor, 6450 Hembree Lane

The following Goodwill locations will accept physical donations for those impacted by the floods: 3535 Industrial Drive, Santa Rosa; 651 Yolanda Avenue, Santa Rosa; 1300 4th Street, Santa Rosa; 6450 Hembree Lane, Windsor; 6826 Sebastopol Avenue, Sebastopol

REPORTE DE DAÑOS Para maximizar oportunidades de apoyo estatales y federales, alentamos a los residentes afectados por la inundación a registrar con exactitud TODAS las pérdidas, incluyendo daños a la propiedad, pertenencias personales, vehículos y artículos grandes y pequeños.pic.twitter.com/bFCA0w3lEw

¡No se deje engañar por el hielo negro! La nieve derretida, las carreteras mojadas y las bajas temperaturas contribuyen a que se forme el hielo negro y este hace que las carreteras se vuelvan resbalosas, especialmente los puentes y rampas. Más info: https://www.weather.gov/safety/winter-spanish …pic.twitter.com/gaZyaNRUos

Do not be misled by black ice! The melting snow/ wet roads & the low temperatures can result in the formation of black ice. Black ice is difficult to see and makes roads very slippery, especially bridges & overpasses. Drive safe! More info: http://weather.gov/winter #WinterSafetypic.twitter.com/ysE3Lnocye

IMPORTANTE: Se extiende acción ejecutiva que mantiene la prohibición del aumento de precios de alquiler en situaciones de emergencia hasta el 31 de mayo de 2019. Incluye los Condados de Sonoma, Napa, Mendocino, Lake, Santa Barbara, Shasta, Siskiyou y Ventura. No se deje engañar.pic.twitter.com/Rknv4JMtoP

IMPORTANT: On Wednesday, Governor Jerry Brown issued an executive order that extends the state’s prohibition on price gouging during emergencies. It'll remain in effect until May 31, 2019 for the Counties of Sonoma Napa, Mendocino, Lake, Santa Barbara, Shasta, Siskiyou & Ventura.pic.twitter.com/8Mqe572DpI

SoCoAlert Subscribers: We recommend you save this number 866-419-5000 in your contacts. That is the number that you will be receiving calls from in an emergency. We also suggest saving it under "favorites" so the calls will go through even if you are on “Do not disturb” mode.

....made 2 arrests (1 felony, 1 misdemeanor DUI), and stored 3 vehicles. Street Racing and Side Show activity is extremely unsafe and something we take very seriously. We don’t want this activity to occur in our neighborhoods and we know you don’t either.

The suspect was a serial burglar. Petaluma has experienced an increase in power equipment thefts, both from secured buildings and vehicles. With the arrest, officers will review evidence from similar, prior thefts to ascertain if there are any connections to him.

The business experienced an approximate $3,000.00 loss. Around 5:30 PM, an officer saw a male, matching the suspect’s description, across the street from the police department and attempted to contact him. The male ran but was detained following a short foot pursuit.

An unknown male walked forced his way into one storage shed, entered the beds and trailers of work trucks, and removed landscaping related equipment. The suspect returned around 11AM, forced his way into another secured storage shed, and removed more equipment.
On September 15, 2019, Petaluma Police investigated the burglary of a small landscaping business. Video surveillance revealed the initial burglary around 6:00 PM the previous evening.

Is there a safe temp to leave a dog alone inside a parked car? Not really. It’s best to leave your pet at home where you know he’s safe. If you do need to take your dog along, use common sense and pay close attention to outside temperatures and how long he’s been in the car.

Another reason why it’s a bad idea to leave the car running is if the engine dies, the cool air or heat goes away. Meanwhile, a dog is put at risk of becoming too hot or too cold while their owner is unaware there’s a problem.

Leaving the motor running is a bad idea, even if you’ve cracked a window to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning in winter or leave the air conditioning running in the summer. An unrestrained pet can accidentally put the car in gear, which happened in West Virginia.

As much as a car can heat up in summer temps, it can cool down to under freezing just as fast. Pets that don’t normally spend a lot of time outside in the winter are more susceptible to the cold when left alone inside a vehicle. Hypothermia can become a risk at 50 degrees.
To understand the heat your pet experiences while waiting in the car, sit in it for 10 to 30 minutes with the windows cracked. Keep in mind, your dog is also wearing a fur coat.

WHAT TEMP IS SAFE TO LEAVE A DOG IN THE CAR? When the temp is 70° a car can heat up to 89° in 10 min, 104 in 30. At 80° outside, you’re looking at 99° inside in 10 minutes & 114 in 30. At 95° it only takes 10 minutes to reach 114° & the temp soars to 129 degrees in 30 minutes.pic.twitter.com/udic0Y3rJk

Sonoma Pd Handling elder abuse report
But keeping families there could result in violations of the agreement, known as the Flores settlement, that established standards for the detention of children and limits it to 20 days.
There is limited space in the family detention facilities where migrants would be held while the government tries to secure their travel documents, which are required to deport them.

Officials have been nervous about creating scenes of armed agents pulling children from homes and the possibility that some families could be separated. Another big concern is trafficking children to accompany adults for this purpose
The targeted operation is expected to occur over the course of multiple days and is expected in the coming weeks.

The agency has, however, taken steps in recent days to prepare for mass arrests, including requesting the help of Homeland Security investigative agents, who usually conduct long-term investigations into trafficking organizations as opposed to deportations

Morgan's statement to those seeking asylum through coyotes or cartels is “Do not come, Do not pay the cartels an exorbitant amount of money because once you receive due process and get a final order, you will be removed.”

Among the 2,000 warrants are those whose court cases were expedited, having typically missed a court date and been ordered deported from the country in absentia. They were sent letters in February demanding they report to an immigration and customs office to leave the US
The families are usually released to live with relatives in the United States while their deportation cases go through immigration court.

More than 144,200 migrants were taken into custody at the border last month, the highest monthly total in 13 years. Many of them seek asylum but only a minority of them ultimately win their cases in immigration courts.

The acting director of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency, Mark Morgan, announced that agents would target more than 2,000 immigrant family members who ALREADY have deportation orders and failed to report to an immigration agency field office for deportation
An agent cannot simply stop you and demand proof of residency. These are individuals who have had warrants placed upon them specifically.

CLARIFICATION ON I.C.E. SWEEPS It is pretty well known at this point that our current administration has announced massive ICE arrests and sweeps throughout the Bay Area over the coming week. This is not a random door to door operation.

When an Evacuation Warning happens, be prepared to “Go!” Place your emergency supply kit in your vehicle, keep your pets nearby, and ensure your family is ready to leave at a moment’s notice. There's a science to timber harvesting! Timber harvesting creates resiliency to fire, insects, and disease by reducing overstocked forest conditions. Ensure you are properly disposing of ashes created by your fireplace or wood burning stove. Place ashes in a bucket made of non-flammable material, and only store that bucket on concrete or bare mineral soil. A deck can catch fire from transferred heat. #FireplaceSafetypic.twitter.com/Cwm3kW0wYS
